page.title: 10LOCAL INDUSTRY WOODGREEN RD.
page.content:
The only industrial site in the area. It was first used in the 19th century as a plant nursery.A pottery was opened alongside to supply the nursery.Making pots from a local London clay (a blue, porous clay).Both the nursery and the pottery closed in 1964.The site is now owned by G.A.Tuck Ltd. who lease out various sections to two engineering companies,a print works and a car repair shop.Goods produced at these sites are sold nationwide.There are 3 main buildings on this site and an office. Below are figures of work and travel
for this area| 1) Local work=45% 1) Primary=6.25% 2) Travel =55% 2) Secondary=18.75% 3) Tertiary=75% By David Perry
